Game

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    A Grid represents the game field of Tetris.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Grid(int height, int width, Lock lock)
      Creates a new Grid with the given height and width.

        width - the width of the Grid
        lock - the game's Lock object

        Adds a Block to the coordinates represented by the passed Location object.
        Parameters:
        block - to be placed
        location - of the top left corner of the area the Block is to be placed in

      • regularStep

        public void regularStep()
        Standard update to the Grid; each block is moved one unit down.

      • moveBlock

        public void moveBlock(Block block,
                      Location.Direction direction)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Moves the Block in the given Direction. A Direction can either be LEFT or RIGHT, and is specified in Location.Direction.
        Parameters:
        block - the Block to move
        direction - the Direction to move the Block
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • clearLines

        public void clearLines()
        Clears any lines in the Grid that have been cleared by the user.

      • rotateBlock

        public void rotateBlock(Block block,
                        Location.Direction direction)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Rotates the passed Block in the given Direction.
        Parameters:
        block - the Block to be moved
        direction - the Direction of rotation - either CLOCKWISE or COUNTERCLOCKWISE
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the rotation direction is invalid

      • holdBlock

        public void holdBlock(Block block,
                      boolean spawnNewBlock)
        Holds the given Block and spawns a new one.
        Parameters:
        block - the Block to hold
        spawnNewBlock - whether or not to spawn a new Block after holding
